Package io.github.vecmatlib.matrix

Record Class Double4x4

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
io.github.vecmatlib.matrix.Double4x4
Record Components:
m11 - The first element of the first row.
m12 - The second element of the first row.
m13 - The third element of the first row.
m14 - The fourth element of the first row.
m21 - The first element of the second row.
m22 - The second element of the second row.
m23 - The third element of the second row.
m24 - The fourth element of the second row.
m31 - The first element of the third row.
m32 - The second element of the third row.
m33 - The third element of the third row.
m34 - The fourth element of the third row.
m41 - The first element of the fourth row.
m42 - The second element of the fourth row.
m43 - The third element of the fourth row.
m44 - The fourth element of the fourth row.
All Implemented Interfaces:
MatrixDoubleOperations<Double4x4,Double4>, MatrixOperations<Double4x4,Double4>
public record Double4x4(double m11, double m12, double m13, double m14, double m21, double m22, double m23, double m24, double m31, double m32, double m33, double m34, double m41, double m42, double m43, double m44) extends Record implements MatrixDoubleOperations<Double4x4,Double4>
Record that represents a 4x4 double matrix.
Author:
Nico

  • Method Details

    • plus

      public Double4x4 plus(Double4x4 matrix)
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Computes the sum of this matrix with the given one.

      The sum of two matrices m1 and m2 of the same dimensions is a matrix m3 such that every element m-ij of m3 is the sum of the element m-ij of m1 and the element m-ij of m2.

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      Specified by:
      plus in interface MatrixOperations<Double4x4,Double4>
      Parameters:
      matrix - The second operand of the sum, a matrix of the same type as this one.
      Returns:
      The sum of this matrix and the given one.

    • negative

      public Double4x4 negative()
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Computes the additive inverse of this matrix.

      The additive inverse of a matrix m is a matrix -m such that m + (-m) is a matrix where every element m-ij is 0.

      Specified by:
      negative in interface MatrixOperations<Double4x4,Double4>
      Returns:
      The additive inverse of this matrix.

    • minus

      public Double4x4 minus(Double4x4 matrix)
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Computes the subtraction of the given matrix from this one.

      The subtraction of a matrix m2 from a matrix m1 is defined as the sum of m1 with the additive inverse of m2. That is m1 - m2 = m1 + (-m2)

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      Specified by:
      minus in interface MatrixOperations<Double4x4,Double4>
      Parameters:
      matrix - The second operand of the subtraction, a matrix of the same type as this one.
      Returns:
      The subtraction of this matrix and the given one.

    • multipliedBy

      public Double4x4 multipliedBy(double k)
      Description copied from interface: MatrixDoubleOperations
      Multiplies this matrix with the given scalar.

      The product of a matrix m and a scalar k is a matrix m' such that every element m'-ij is the product of the element m-ij and k.

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      Specified by:
      multipliedBy in interface MatrixDoubleOperations<Double4x4,Double4>
      Parameters:
      k - The scalar to which this matrix is multiplied.
      Returns:
      The product of this matrix and the given scalar.

    • multiply

      public Double4 multiply(Double4 vector)
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Computes the product between this matrix and the given vector.

      The product between a matrix and a vector is the linear combination between all the columns of the matrix and all the elements of the vector.

      The product can also be defined as a vector where every element is the dot product of the corresponding row of the matrix and the vector.

      A vector and a matrix can only be multiplied if the matrix has the same number of columns as the vector has elements.

      Specified by:
      multiply in interface MatrixOperations<Double4x4,Double4>
      Parameters:
      vector - The second operand of the product, a vector whose size is the same as the number of columns of this matrix.
      Returns:
      The result of the product between this matrix and the given vector.

    • transposed

      public Double4x4 transposed()
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Computes the transposed of this matrix.

      A transposed matrix is a matrix where every row i is the column i of the first matrix and every column j is the row j of the first matrix.

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      Specified by:
      transposed in interface MatrixOperations<Double4x4,Double4>
      Returns:
      The transposed of this matrix.

    • isSymmetric

      public boolean isSymmetric()
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Checks if this matrix is symmetric.

      A matrix is symmetric if it is equal to its transposed. In other words, if every element m-ij of this matrix is equal to the element m-ji of this matrix.

      In other words, a matrix is symmetric if it is equal to its transposed.

      Specified by:
      isSymmetric in interface MatrixOperations<Double4x4,Double4>
      Returns:
      True if this matrix is symmetric, false otherwise.

    • isSkewSymmetric

      public boolean isSkewSymmetric()
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Checks if this matrix is skew-symmetric.

      A matrix is skew-symmetric if it is equal to its negative transposed. In other words, if every element m-ij of this matrix is equal to the element -(m-ji) of this matrix.

      In other words, a matrix is skew-symmetric if it is equal to its negative transposed.

      Specified by:
      isSkewSymmetric in interface MatrixOperations<Double4x4,Double4>
      Returns:
      True if this matrix is skew-symmetric, false otherwise.

    • multiply

      public Double4x4 multiply(Double4x4 matrix)
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Multiplies this matrix by the given one.

      Two matrices can only be multiplied if the first one has the same number of rows as the second one has columns.

      The product between two matrices m1 and m2 is a matrix m3 such that every element m-ij of m3 is the dot product of the i-th row of m1 and the j-th column of m2.

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      Specified by:
      multiply in interface MatrixOperations<Double4x4,Double4>
      Parameters:
      matrix - The second operand of the product
      Returns:
      The product of this matrix and the given one.

    • power

      public Double4x4 power(int exponent)
      Description copied from interface: MatrixOperations
      Computes the power of this matrix.

      The n-th power of a matrix is the product of itself n times.

      Only square matrices can be raised to a power.

      Matrices are supposed to be immutable. This means that this method does not alter the object on which it is called, it returns a new matrix instead.

      Specified by:
      power in interface MatrixOperations<Double4x4,Double4>
      Parameters:
      exponent - Exponent of the power.
      Returns:
      The n-th power of this matrix.
